poem:
### The Theatre of Questions

In the hall where voices rise,  
words tumble like stones—  
softened by intention,  
just a masquerade of discord.  
A man beyond the sea spins  
a yarn so ineffable,  
even silence blushes;  
and the stage,  
briefly, holds its breath—  
waiting for truth to find  
a tongue.
